author: Andrew Swan
comment: Good. Only counter which not only counts but also logs when was counted. Use it to keep track of hay and straw bales used in our stables. End of the month I can see when and how many were used. 4 stars because there is no automatic backup function. And I would like a default month summary view. Again, this is the only counter which does more than count. I tried loads. Good work

author: Jonathan Doyle
comment: Paywall makes custom lists impossible, so unless you want to count the default 4 things this isn't very useful

author: Henry Savage
comment: If you're using this app professionally, it's the way to go. Quick exports with .csv, only wished I could export with excel. Great app though.

author: princessthea
comment: Works great! Just wish I could retroactively add data...
Easy to use, but no calendar.

author: Erdem Çalışkan
comment: Hi, I love this app. LOVE IT LOVE IT LOVE IT.

author: Ricardo Ribeiro
comment: Like it but can be improved

author: Sharon Nelson
comment: Easy

author: Jonah Jensen-Young
comment: Wow, awesome app! This helps keep track of my students' behavior in class. A minor gripe with the Android wear app is that it doesn't work standalone and also when I press + on my watch the number stays the same but updates right away on the phone. It's only when I restart the watch app that I see the updated tally. It would be great to see the increasing tallies as soon as I enter them on the watch. Happy to support developing this amazing utility! Thanks - LG Watch Sport and Note3.

author: Leo Staley
comment: Could have more features, but is closest to what I'm looking for over everything else out there.  6/28/17 edit; i know it was like a year and a a half ago, but the change to material design ruined the app. I used to be able to fit all of my counters on one page. Now, the same number of counters takes up a good 30% more vertical space, because material design requires you to waste as much usable space as possible.

It helps me keep track of things. Simple to use, pretty intuitive to setup and useful. Sure they have adds, but pay for the upgrade if you don't want them...the developers need a little money too. Again , this a good simple counter program

author: FoodifyFlorida
comment: I like the concept but it would be nice if there were graphs showing statistics and even correlations as an option. Whats the point of counting something logging the date and time and having no useful way to correlate or graph the data.

author: Zach Troy
comment: Very simple and still very functional. Looks fairly nice, and I love that it has an Android Wear app that syncs with your phone. Would like automatic cloud sync, but right now I just back it up manually to Google drive.

author: Alex Martinelli
comment: Simple and immediate, exactly what one would expect from a counter app. Though would be useful to have the option of exporting all data of all counters in one go, instead of having to go into each counter and specify date range, which is cumbersome the more counters you have, and the more frequently you want to do the exports.

author: LockMacFly
comment: It's great until you tap restart and miss the short undo pop-up. Half a year of tracking gone. Also to zoom out and edit the graphs doesn't work too well

author: BlazingSun72
comment: Works really well, and has a history so if you accidentally reset a counter you can check where it was. Wants me to rate it even though I already have

author: Smokie Lee
comment: I can't tell you if the features in the free version are good because every time you click an option in the app an ad - half of them with sound - would play. I don't mind the ad at the bottom of the main screen, but all the ones behind every click are really irritating.   Free version doesn't have enough features for me to make a determination on whether to pay the full $3.49 to unlock all features. I don't want to spend $.99 to remove ads when there isn't any other functionality.   Like another reviewer said, if you want to count the four default things then the free version may work for you. Oh and if you don't mind audio ads playing every time you click anything.

author: Larry H
comment: The king of counting apps. Goes way beyond other with export to CSV, backup, categories, details about every change to a count and more. Yes, it is a paid app to get the good stuff, but developers have to put food on the table too.

author: Vlad
comment: Nice app but was expected to have a restart of the counters in the scheduled actions like every week. I could improve my rate if it was possible soon! :)

reply.author: Keep It Simple
reply.content: Hello Vladimir, you can do that for each counter individually. I'm considering automation for groups, I will let you know when that's available.

author: Gary Fenster
comment: I was looking for a good tracking app. This app has records and graphs.Other counter app's are just counters, this app has other necessary information in addition. I highly recommend this app, including the premium upgrade of it, to anyone who needs to track data of anything whatever.

author: Adam Hewett
comment: It has no option to auto reset. How the hell do I keep track of calories or runs or whether I worked out or not or anything if it doesn't auto reset. What is wrong with these counter app makers it's like they never use their own product.

author: Fra Uli
comment: nice app. the timestamp makes it more vulnerable. but i cant find the widget in my widget register. is this a premium feature?

author: שגיא יצחקי
comment: Please add an option to categorize a number of items at once instead of doing so one by one and also an option to always see the sum of all items in each category or in general. Also, I'd like to see the list of a particular category and not all the items on the widget of this app.

author: Lisa Levine
comment: I guess I misunderstood app. I was hoping for an app to tally items per day, and then show graph over time.

author: Ethan Rowley
comment: On smart watch the number doesn't update till the app is re opened hard to keep track because of this otherwise great app

author: Susie Ellis
comment: Can't make any counter have a custom name unless you pay for the damn thing.

author: Chris O'Brien
comment: Does everything I want it to, but was very intrusive in asking for a review

author: Gabrielle Desdoigts
comment: Wish you could manually add entries with a time stamp, or edit old entries to adjust the time or add a note. Better descriptions of what resetting counters does would help too.

author: Finlay Mirkwood
comment: Not perfect, but more or less gets the job done.

author: Jesse Chalupsky
comment: Works well for what it does. Gives me the ability to have multiple items to track, some daily, some weekly and some monthly and reset them each accordingly.  Love the widget.

author: Ed Bockelman
comment: It's simple, well laid out, and does what I want. I chose this one over others because it gives the option to export to csv file.

author: Patrick Nelson
comment: I use it for my vending machines to make a quick refill list.  Works perfect for what I need.

author: Slava Abakumov
comment: Schedule: daily restart doesn't work.
I'd recommend adding comparative statistics and the ability to edit counters while in categories

author: Dan Bracket_fredyfrankle1
comment: Beep please not just vibrate

author: Evan Humphress
comment: Does what it says it does. That's all you can ask for, really.

author: Sebastian
comment: The app don't let me import the backup file

author: Peđa Čačić
comment: Does what it suposed to do. No system impact, as it's suposed to be. Recommended.

author: Amin Riyad
comment: Used it in a medical research.. Helped a lot in counting through files

author: Angelo Mosquera
comment: It has everything I need, it's simple, has a beautiful interface and it even has a CSV exporter!!
